document.id: Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board Res. No. 2025-169
document.heading: Amending LCO TCL PHS, Tattoo and Body Piercing Ordinance

recital.text: the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians is a federally recognized Indian tribe ("Tribe") organized pursuant to the provisions of the Indian Reorganization Act of 1934, 25 U.S.C. ยง5101, et seq.; and,

the Tribal Governing Board serves as the governing body of Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians pursuant to Article III, ยง 1 of the Amended Constitution and Bylaws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians; and

pursuant to Article V, ยง 1(n) of the Amended Constitution and By-laws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians, the Tribal Governing Board is empowered to "regulate, by enactment of ordinances, the conduct of business within the territory of the band"; and

pursuant to Article V, Section 1 (s) of the Amended Constitution and Bylaws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians, the Tribal Governing Board possesses certain powers, including: "To promulgate and enforce ordinances governing the conduct of members of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians of Wisconsin and providing for the maintenance of law and order and the administration of justice by establishing a tribal court and defining its duties and powers."; and
the Tribal Governing Board duly enacted the Lac Courte Oreilles Tattoo and Body Piercing Ordinance to regulate any related activities on reservation.
that the Tribal Governing Board hereby determines that it is in the best interest of the Tribe to amend the Tattoo and Body Piercing Ordinance.

recital.conjunction: NOW THEREFORE BE IT FINALLY RESOLVED,
recital.text: that the attached amendment Title PHS.7 Tattoo and Body Piercing Ordinance of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Code of Law, including all Attachments, shall be, and hereby is, amended and enacted as an ordinance of the Tribe, pursuant to Article IV, ยง 3 of the Amended Constitution and Bylaws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians as follows:

para.text: PHS.7.1.080 General Definitions is amended as follows: "(g)" "Tattoo and Body Piercing Regulator or Division" can be used interchangeably and means any agencies or individual(s) designated by the Tribal Governing Board, who shall be authorized to make investigations or inspections of tattooists, body piercers, tattoo establishments and body piercing establishments, including vendors at any venue, and recommend to the Tribe whether an establishment or practitioner be licensed or is in compliance with the requirements of this law;

PHS.7.1.120 Establishment License is amended as follows: "(c)" "Temporary Establishments" For a temporary tattoo or body piercing establishment or a temporary combined tattoo and body piercing establishment, the operator of the establishment shall pay a fee of $100 per application. The fee shall not be returned if the establishment fails the inspection. For any temporary establishment(s) operating at a venue held by or at the Sevenwinds Casino, Lodge & Conference Center, the Department/Regulators may waive the fee.

The fee shall not be returned if the establishment fails the inspection. For any temporary establishment(s) operating at a venue held by or at the Sevenwinds Casino, Lodge & Conference Center, the Department/Regulators may waive the fee.

PHS.7.1.130 Practitioner License is amended as follows: "(a)" "Requirement" No person may tattoo or body pierce another person, use or assume the title of tattooist or body piercer or designate or represent himself or herself as a tattooist or body piercer unless the person has obtained a practitioner license from the Department by application made upon a form furnished by the Department. An application submitted to the Department shall be accompanied by the fee required under Section PHS.7.1.130(d), unless waived under Section PHS.7.1.130(d)(3). The fee shall be returned in full if the application is denied.

PHS.7.1.140 Approval of Licenses is amended as follows: "(b)" The Division shall not recommend the Department issue a license to a new tattoo or body-piercing establishment or a new operator at an existing establishment without completing a prior inspection of the establishment to ensure that the establishment complies with the requirements of this law. In the instance that the temporary establishment is operating at an event or venue held by or at the Sevenwinds Casino, Lodge & Conference Center, the Division shall be allowed to recommend a license to any vendor, however, the Division must inspect the vendors booth/area and ensure it complies with this ordinance prior to the vendor offering any services.
